name: James Horey
body:
### About Me
I'm interested in "big data" systems, parallel programming models, and privacy/security algorithms. My approach to work is primarily systems and software-oriented: I identify real-world problems, design and implement a novel solution in software, and experimentally validate the software. I also happen to work at Oak Ridge National Lab as a research scientist.  

### Projects
I have both "official" and "for fun" projects. 

* I (and many of my colleagues at ORNL) have been helping the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) modernize their analytic capabilities. Here are some links from the press:
http://gcn.com/articles/2012/03/09/cms-analytics-project-health-care-big-data.aspx
http://technews.tmcnet.com/knowledge-management/topics/knowledge-management/articles/303131-cms-unveils-knowledge-discovery-infrastructure-aims-patient-data.htm
* [Spot Hadoop](https://github.com/jhorey/SpotHadoop): Spot-Hadoop is a tool to dynamically configure, launch, and benchmark Hadoop on shared, parallel filesystems (namely Lustre).
* [Paja](https://github.com/jhorey/Paja): Paja is an implementation of Paxos for Java.
* [KevaDB](https://github.com/jhorey/KevaDB): KevaDB is a key-value storage library for Java with support for multiple branches and historical values.

### Publications
I also happen to publish papers once a while. I am in the process of releasing some of these results in a more suitable format (i.e., GitHub). In the meantime here is a simple list in chronological order. 

* "Performance Implications from Sizing a VM on Multi-core Systems: A Data Analytic Application's View", Seung-Hwan Lim, James Horey, Yanjun Yao, Edmon Begoli, and Qing Cao. High-Performance Grid and Cloud Computing Workshop (with IPDPS) (2013)
* "Design Principles for Effective Knowledge Discovery from Big Data", Edmon Begoli and James Horey. IEEE Conference on Software Architecture (2012)
* "Big Data Platforms as a Service: Challenges and Approach", James Horey, Edmon Begoli, Raghul Gunasekaran, Seung-Hwan Lim, and James Nutaro. Usenix Workshop on Hot Topics in Cloud Computing (2012)
* "Reconstructing Spatial Distributions from Anonymized Locations", James Horey, Stephanie Forrest, and Michael Groat. Workshop on Secure Data Management on Smartphones and Mobiles (with IEEE ICDE) (2012)
* "Enhancing Privacy in Participatory Sensing Applications with Multidimensional Data", Michael Groat, Benjamin Edwards, James Horey, Wenbo He, Stephanie Forrest. IEEE International Conference on Pervasive Computing and Communications (2012)
* "Latency Minimizing Tasking for Information Processing Systems", James Horey, and Brent Lagesse. International Workshop on Knowledge Discovery Using Cloud and Distributed Platforms (with IEEE ICDM) (2011)
* "Challenges in Scheduling Aggregation in CyberPhysical Information Processing Systems", James Horey. International Workshop on Knowledge Discovery Using Cloud and Distributed Platforms (with IEEE ICDM) (2010)
* "A Programming Framework for Integrating Web-based Spatiotemporal Sensor Data with MapReduce Capabilities", James Horey. International Workshop on GeoStreaming (with ACM GIS) (2010)
* "Tables: A Table-Based Language Environment for Sensor Networks", James Horey, Eric Nelson, and Arthur B. Maccabe. IEEE International Conference on Distributed Computing in Sensor Networks (DCOSS) (2010)
* "A Filesystem Interface for Sensor Networks", James Horey, Ann Kilzer, Jean-Charles Tournier, Patrick Widener, and Arthur B. Maccabe. Workshop on Hot Topics in Embedded Networked Sensors (HotEmNets) (2008)
* "Anonymous Data Collection in Sensor Networks", James Horey, Michael Groat, Stephanie Forrest, and Fernando Esponda. International Conference on Mobile and Ibuquitous Systems: Computing, Networking, and Services (Mobiquitous) (2007)
* "Kensho: A Dynamic Tasking Architecture for Sensor Networks", James Horey, Arthur Maccabe, and Angela Mielke. Workshop on Wireless Sensor Network Architecture (with IPSN) (2007)
